name: Hostellerie de l'Abbaye

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The hotel is just a Michelin one house hotel, so we didn't expect much, but it was just fine. Not posh, but very pleasant and well-kept. Our room is actually two -- a very large room with a large bed and a second room with three twin beds. The people at the reception desk were not exactly charming, but they were polite.
reviews.title: A simple, but excellent hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We ate dinner outside, our first on this trip because of the cool weather, and it was a really excellent meal! Slices of scallop with greens, followed by sautéed veal chop with morels and potatoes. Chevre with cooked onions on it. Molten chocolate cake with vanilla ice cream -- just terrible!!! This turned out to be one of the best dinners we had in our month in the south of France!
reviews.title: Logis's mistake our gain

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: When we looked through the Logis book this place is listed as a single chimney and a single marmite pot..not right! The website correctly identifies it as a 3 chimney and three pot.
reviews.title: A nice hotel in the Var

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: It is a modern building with very good sized rooms with excellent air con. The hotel is set back from the main road through the town in a quiet residential location. There is a nice refreshing (sic cold) pool and sun terrace to the rear which is shaded by surrounding trees.
reviews.title: Staff in need of charm school training

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: On arrival we were given the disappointing room that the restaurant would have a limited selection that evening because of a fire a few days previously and that we would have to have breakfast in the restaurant. In neither instances did this detract in any way from our enjoyment.
reviews.title: Good rooms and lovely restaurant

description: L'Hostellerie de l'Abbaye is a charming hotel nestled within an ancestral pine forest on the edge of the village of Le Thoronet.Our premier facilities will make your stay comfortable and memorable.Located in the heart of "Provence verte"" our Inn features 23 spacious ans comfortable rooms, a beautiful gourmet restaurant overlooking a landscaped garden and a swimming pool with a waterfall.Many activities are available at the Inn and nearby.
